title: Make the horizontal timeline easier to understand and more polished

requirements.text: Improve the horizontal Timeline section so users immediately understand it is horizontally scrollable and can clearly read the date/time for each milestone, while keeping the section compact and visually romantic.

acceptanceCriteria: Timeline clearly communicates horizontal navigation via at least two visual affordances (e.g., subtle left/right edge fades, an inline hint text like “Scroll to explore →”, visible drag/scroll indicator, or arrow controls).
Each timeline card’s date is visually distinct (font weight/size/contrast) and remains easy to scan on mobile and desktop.
No user-facing text added for guidance uses non-English language (all guidance/hints must be English).
Horizontal timeline remains shorter than an equivalent vertical list and does not introduce long vertical scrolling.

requirements.text: Add optional, non-intrusive navigation helpers for the horizontal timeline to make browsing milestones feel smooth and “finished” (e.g., snap-to-card behavior and/or left-right controls that scroll one card at a time).

i eant to just look good

acceptanceCriteria: Users can reliably move through timeline items without precision scrolling on both trackpad/mouse and touch (mobile).
If snap behavior is implemented, the scroll position settles cleanly on a card boundary (no awkward half-visible cards after interaction).
Any added controls do not overlap timeline content and remain accessible on small screens.

requirements.text: Polish the Timeline section visuals to look cleaner and more premium while preserving the existing events, card layout, and reveal animation style (no new content; only presentation/UX improvements).

quotes: i eant to just look good

acceptanceCriteria: All existing timeline events (date, title, 1-line description) remain unchanged and in the same order as currently implemented.

Existing entrance/reveal animation behavior remains (items animate in as they come into view), but the overall timeline looks more cohesive (spacing, alignment, and decorative line/dots feel intentional).
Design continues to avoid blue/purple tones for timeline UI elements.

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Keep the timeline content (dates/titles/descriptions) exactly as currently defined in the Timeline section; do not add/remove milestones.
Do not introduce blue/purple tones into new UI elements.
nonGoals: Changing the Hero section content or layout.
Changing Proposal section behavior (Yes/No interactions) as part of this request.
Adding backend logic, storage, or any new canister methods.
